item.title: Tree shedding a lot of bark, 15th August
item.description:
The Tree opposite our house is shedding a lot of bark and I am concerned this might be a sign of disease (photos attached). The tree is opposite 26/28 Hammelton Road. It also requires trimming as the tree has grown so much the branches are over the drives on the opposite side of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hammelton Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin again, 15th August
item.description:
Dear [Council/Waste Management Team], I hope this message finds you well. Could you please arrange for the bin located in the alleyway by 79 King Hall Road, leading up to Clock House Station, to be emptied as soon as possible? It is currently overflowing, and this area is frequently missed during regular collections. The situation is now posing a health and safety concern for local residents. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Kind regards,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposting on lamp post, 15th August
item.description:
Reported this the other day but team couldn't find it. Lamp post ID: 621 10. Car advert tied to lamp post next to traffic lights, junction of Green Lane and Parish Lane. In front of Provincial Terrace.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Walkway closed with no safe route or signs for pedestrians, 15th August
item.description:
Roadworks have closed half of the road and the walkway on the northeast side of the road. There are no advance warning signs for pedestrians to indicate that the walkway is closed and there is no safe route or crossing for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94, Kirkdale, Forest Hill, London

item.title: Contractors Leaving Rubbish, 15th August
item.description:
Following your contractors replacing the damaged drain covers, they have left this area in appalling condition. They have left all the repair rubbish all over this area. Peabody should have them return to clear up this mess. It might be woodlands but they would not been allowed to leave all this rubbish if it was in a street. I can't belive that Peabody had not checked on there work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent burning of garden waste, 15th August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mortimer Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on the road, 15th August
item.description:
I would like to raise a concern regarding rubbish collection in our area. Every Friday, after the bins are emptied, a significant amount of litter is often left scattered on the streets. Unfortunately, this rubbish sometimes remains there for several days or even weeks. This situation is particularly worrying for families with young children, as they may try to pick up the litter, which poses health and safety risks. I kindly ask that this issue be looked into, and that steps be taken to ensure the streets are properly cleaned after collections. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blandford Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins shouldn't be here, 15th August
item.description:
There's often rubbish under this bridge and there's been a stray brown bin for a while but they have multiplied. This is not where anyone should be storing their bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Urlwin Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
